column1: Noor is making coffee at a busy shop. Noor wants to make a yummy coffee with oat milk for a person. Noor picks a milk jar and puts oat milk in it. Noor thinks the milk jar has oat milk. Noor wants to make coffee with almond milk. Noor sees the pretty cup fall from shelf.
column3: Noor will make the coffee using the milk in the jar.
column4: Noor will open the fridge again, take out the oat milk, and swap out the almond milk.

column1: Zara is attending an art exhibition at a local gallery in her town. Zara wants to learn more about a particular abstract painting she admires. The label next to the artwork states that the painting is the work of a famous artist, and Zara reads the label carefully. Zara believes that the painting is the work of a famous artist. A gallery visitor accidentally spills a glass of water near the painting. Zara does not observe the water spill.
column3: Zara will look for more information about the famous artist.
column4: Zara will look for more information about the emerging artist.

column1: Carlos is a farmer in a little place, watching his corn field. He wants to give water to his plants by opening a water door connected to a river nearby. Carlos closed the water door last night. Carlos thinks the water door is closed now. A group of big birds comes to the corn field. Carlos doesn't see the big birds in his field.
column3: Carlos will phone his friend to ask if they can open the water door.
column4: Carlos will phone his friend to ask if they can close the water door.

column1: Kofi catches fish in a little place in Ghana. He wants to catch lots of fish today for his family and to sell some. Kofi fixed his fish net last night. Kofi thinks his fish net is good now. A group of kids start to play a ball game near the water. Kofi doesn't see the kids playing.
column3: Kofi will use his net to catch fish.
column4: Kofi will buy new fixing stuff to fix the fish net.

column1: Ravi is a farmer in a small place in India, looking after his mango trees. Ravi wants to pick ripe mangoes to sell them. He sees a mango tree with a big branch full of ripe mangoes. Ravi thinks the branch has ripe mangoes to pick. A pretty bird walks through the trees, showing its pretty feathers. Ravi doesn't see the pretty bird walking through the trees.
column3: Ravi will pick ripe mangoes from the branch.
column4: Ravi will look for another tree with ripe mangoes.

column1: Hana is a little girl who lives in a house with a big garden. Hana wants to play with her bouncy ball in the garden. She sees her bouncy ball in the corner, shiny and round.
